featured.text: While early zoos put emphasis on displaying as many unusual creatures as possible, most modern zoos now focus on conservation and education.
It has long been assumed that creativity is some unusual trait enjoyed by the few.
During the second Industrial Age, people toiled at unusual hours in mines or factories and often had to get up for work early in the morning.
So she was trucked to a most unusual orphanage in Nairobi, run by a woman named Daphne Sheldrick.
29 , it is not unusual for them to come up with a decision before they have the time to do so.

other.text: The blood-type belief has been used in unusual ways.
Sometimes, people pick foreign names for their children because those names are unusual and will thus make their children more 39 and distinctive.
Australia has lots of very unusual animals.
In ancient Greece, what did the priests do to show people they had unusual power?
The consumption of alcoholic beverages was unusual in ancient Russia.
The ordinary woman’s leather shoe is considered unusual because _______.

definition.zh_def: 不尋常的，與常規或常見的事物不同。
definition.en_def: Not common or ordinary; different from what is usual.
definition.example: Her unusual talent for painting amazed everyone.
